channel.title: My first real project using axoloti
channel.description:
it's a hardstyle synth remake using axoloti soft/firmware!
original song is called "Colors of life" by "Coone"
here's the main synth without after editing: https://youtu.be/loXRHylIQPo
and with some compression, equalizing and a little longer reverb i got this: https://www.dropbox.com/s/zybmgtu7ee4p35k/colors%20of%20life%20synth%20axo.mp3?dl=1
tell me what you think :smile:

item.title: My first real project using axoloti
item.dc:creator: @Inaba ramon
item.description:
@Inaba wrote:

and another update to the project: changed polyvoice to 4 instead of 5, giving me the ability to get a stereo 4 band equalizer, stereo compressor and a little reverb!

the result now sounds even more hardstyle-like (and thus closer to the original):

Read full topic
item.source: My first real project using axoloti

item.title: My first real project using axoloti
item.dc:creator: @Inaba ramon
item.description:
@Inaba wrote:

thanks

i really enjoy fiddling with the axoloti software, now that i know i can make quite epic supersaws with it!

here's a small update, re-rendered the same midi (with added sublayer this time, total 4 out of 5 voices being played) and removed the lowpass filters and reverb in axoloti software, now i only needed to add about 2DB starting at 8KHZ, for the rest the same effects are applied: reverb and multiband compressor.

though the result is alot different!

Read full topic
item.source: My first real project using axoloti

item.title: My first real project using axoloti
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

Nice powerful sound. Also not my style of music, but well made sound

Read full topic
item.source: My first real project using axoloti

item.title: My first real project using axoloti
item.dc:creator: @Inaba ramon
item.description:
@Inaba wrote:

well, the quad delay is a standard object in the axoloti software, as said, they are like 4 seperate delays, which you can mix together for a reverb sound

i don't know how that object works internally, but it's an awesome piece for reverb!

and thanks, i'm also pretty satisfied with how the sound came out.
i also got to reduce the after effects on my DAW to a total of 3 wihich still sounds good (1x eq with alot of added high end (over 18DB boost at 20khz!), reverb (about 3,5sec decay), and a 3 band compressor)

Read full topic
item.source: My first real project using axoloti

item.title: My first real project using axoloti
item.dc:creator: @JSZ
item.description:
@JSZ wrote:

Very nice. Not my style of music but well done with the sound. I don't get how the feedback delay network object works, do you have some insight into them? Why are there four inputs and outputs?

Read full topic
